info.name: Blog API - Complete Specification
info.description:
Comprehensive REST API for a blog system built with the Cheshire Framework. This API provides complete CRUD operations for Authors, Articles, and Comments with advanced filtering, full-text search, pagination, and comprehensive statistics.

## Features
- **Author Management**: Create, update, delete, and query authors with article/comment statistics
- **Article Management**: Full CRUD with publishing workflow, advanced search, and content filtering
- **Comment System**: Create and manage comments with rich filtering capabilities
- **Statistics & Reporting**: Comprehensive system-wide statistics and analytics
- **Advanced Filtering**: Full-text search using PostgreSQL tsvector, date ranges, content length filters
- **Pagination**: Consistent pagination across all list endpoints
- **Cascade Operations**: Automatic cascade delete (author → articles → comments)

## Base URL
`http://localhost:8080/api/v1/blog`

## Data Validation
All endpoints include comprehensive validation:
- UUID format validation for IDs
- Email format validation
- String length constraints
- Pattern matching (e.g., username alphanumeric)
- Required vs optional field enforcement

request.description:
Retrieve a paginated collection of authors from the blog system. Supports powerful filtering including:

**Search Capabilities:**
- Wildcard search across username and email
- Full-text search in author's article titles/content
- Date range filtering for author creation

**Statistics Included:**
- Total article count per author
- Published article count
- Comment count on author's articles
- Latest publication date

**Pagination:**
- Default: 50 authors per page
- Configurable from 1-100 per page
- Includes total count and page navigation metadata

**Sorting:**
- Sort by username, email, creation date, or article count
- Ascending or descending order

**Use Cases:**
- Browse all authors with statistics
- Find prolific authors (by article/comment count)
- Search for specific authors by name/email
- Find authors who have written about specific topics

query.description: Username for the author (required, 3-255 chars, alphanumeric + underscores only, pattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$)
Email address for the author (required, valid email format, max 255 chars, must be unique)

request.description:
Create a new author record in the blog system.

**Required Fields:**
- `username`: 3-255 characters, alphanumeric and underscores only, must be unique
- `email`: Valid email format, max 255 characters, must be unique

**Validation:**
- Username pattern: `^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$`
- Email format validation
- Uniqueness check for both username and email
- Input sanitization (trim whitespace, lowercase email)

**Auto-Generated:**
- `id`: UUID (gen_random_uuid())
- `created_at`: Current timestamp

**Response:**
- HTTP 201: Author created successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (invalid format, missing fields)
- HTTP 409: Conflict (username or email already exists)

**Use Cases:**
- Register new blog authors
- Onboard content contributors
- Create user accounts for the blog system

response.name: Error - Duplicate Username

request.description:
Update an existing author's information.

**Required Fields:**
- `id`: Author UUID (must exist in database)

**Optional Fields** (at least one required):
- `username`: New username (3-255 chars, alphanumeric + underscores, unique)
- `email`: New email (valid email format, max 255 chars, unique)

**Validation:**
- Author ID must exist
- At least one field (username or email) must be provided
- Username pattern: `^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$`
- Email format validation
- Uniqueness check (won't conflict with other authors)
- Input sanitization (trim, lowercase email)

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Author updated successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (invalid format, no fields provided)
- HTTP 404: Author not found
- HTTP 409: Conflict (username/email already used by another author)

**Use Cases:**
- Correct author information
- Update email addresses
- Rebrand author username
- Fix typos in author data

response.name: Error - Author Not Found

query.description: Author UUID to delete (required, must be valid UUID format)
Confirmation flag (required, must be true to proceed with deletion)

request.description:
Permanently remove an author from the blog system.

**⚠️ Warning:** This operation uses CASCADE delete:
- Deleting an author will automatically delete ALL their articles
- Deleting articles will automatically delete ALL comments on those articles
- This operation is IRREVERSIBLE

**Required Fields:**
- `id`: Author UUID (must exist in database)
- `confirm`: Must be `true` (safety check to prevent accidental deletion)

**Cascade Effect:**
1. Author record deleted
2. All articles by this author deleted (CASCADE)
3. All comments on those articles deleted (CASCADE)

**Response Includes:**
- Deleted author details
- Count of cascade-deleted articles
- Count of cascade-deleted comments
- Warning message about cascade operations

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Author and related records deleted successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (missing confirmation, invalid ID)
- HTTP 404: Author not found

**Use Cases:**
- Remove spam/abusive authors
- Clean up test data
- GDPR data deletion requests
- Account termination

response.name: Success - Author Deleted with Cascade Info
Error - Missing Confirmation

request.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific author by their unique ID.

**Required Fields:**
- `id`: Author UUID (must exist in database)

**Optional Fields:**
- `include_articles`: Include recent articles (default: false)
- `articles_limit`: Number of recent articles (1-20, default: 5)

**Response Includes:**
- Basic author information (id, username, email, created_at)
- Article statistics:
  - Total articles count
  - Published articles count
  - Draft articles count
  - Average article length
- Comment statistics:
  - Total comments on all articles
- Activity information:
  - Latest publication date
- Optional: Recent articles list

**Statistics Provided:**
- `total_articles`: All articles (published + drafts)
- `published_articles`: Only published articles
- `draft_articles`: Unpublished articles
- `total_comments`: Comments across all articles
- `latest_publication`: Date of most recent published article
- `avg_article_length`: Average content length in characters

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Author details retrieved successfully
- HTTP 400: Invalid ID format
- HTTP 404: Author not found

**Use Cases:**
- Display author profile page
- Show author statistics on blog
- Author dashboard/analytics
- Verify author activity

item.name: Articles
item.description: Operations for managing blog articles. Articles can be created as drafts or published immediately. Each article belongs to an author and can have multiple comments.

url.raw: {{url}}/api/v1/blog/create_article?author_id={{author_id}}&title=Introduction to Functional Java&content=Functional programming brings powerful concepts to Java...&is_published=true&publish_date=2026-01-15T10:00:00

query.description: Author UUID (required, must be valid UUID of existing author)
Article title (required, 1-255 characters)

query.value: Functional programming brings powerful concepts to Java...
query.description: Article content/body (required, minimum 10 characters)
Publication status (optional, boolean, default: false)
Publication date (optional, ISO 8601 date-time format, can be future date)
Comma-separated tags (optional, each tag max 50 chars)

request.description:
Create a new article in the blog system.

**Required Fields:**
- `author_id`: UUID of existing author (validated via foreign key)
- `title`: Article title (1-255 characters)
- `content`: Article body (minimum 10 characters)

**Optional Fields:**
- `is_published`: Publication status (boolean, default: false)
  - `false`: Creates as draft
  - `true`: Publishes immediately
- `publish_date`: Publication date/time (ISO 8601 format)
  - Can be set to future date for scheduled publishing
  - If not provided and is_published=true, uses current timestamp
- `tags`: Array of tags for categorization (each max 50 chars)

**Validation:**
- Author must exist (foreign key constraint)
- Title: trimmed, 1-255 characters
- Content: trimmed, minimum 10 characters
- Input sanitization applied

**Auto-Generated:**
- `id`: UUID (gen_random_uuid())
- `created_at`: Current timestamp
- `updated_at`: Current timestamp

**Response:**
- HTTP 201: Article created successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (invalid format, missing required fields)
- HTTP 404: Author not found

**Use Cases:**
- Create new blog posts
- Save draft articles for later
- Schedule articles for future publication
- Author content management

request.description:
Update an existing article.

**Required Fields:**
- `id`: Article UUID (must exist in database)

**Optional Fields** (at least one required):
- `title`: New title (1-255 characters)
- `content`: New content (minimum 10 characters)
- `is_published`: Change publication status
  - Set to `true` to publish a draft
  - Set to `false` to unpublish an article
- `publish_date`: Update publication date/time

**Automatic Updates:**
- `updated_at`: Automatically set to current timestamp on any update

**Validation:**
- Article ID must exist
- At least one field must be provided for update
- Title and content constraints enforced
- Input sanitization applied

**Common Workflows:**
1. **Publish a Draft**: Set `is_published=true`
2. **Unpublish**: Set `is_published=false`
3. **Edit Content**: Update `title` and/or `content`
4. **Reschedule**: Update `publish_date`

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Article updated successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (no fields provided, invalid format)
- HTTP 404: Article not found

**Use Cases:**
- Edit article content
- Publish draft articles
- Unpublish articles temporarily
- Reschedule publication dates
- Fix typos and update information

request.description:
Retrieve articles by a specific author with advanced filtering options.

**Required Fields:**
- `author_id`: UUID of the author

**Search & Filter Options:**

**Content Search:**
- `search_content`: Full-text search using PostgreSQL tsvector
  - Searches in both title and content fields
  - Ranks results by relevance (ts_rank_cd)
  - Case-insensitive, stemming support

**Status Filters:**
- `published`: Filter by publication status (true/false)

**Date Range Filters:**
- `created_after` / `created_before`: Filter by creation date
- `updated_after`: Filter by last update date

**Engagement Filters:**
- `min_comments` / `max_comments`: Filter by comment count range
- `content_length_min` / `content_length_max`: Filter by article length

**Response Includes:**
- Article preview (first 300 characters)
- Full content length
- Comment count
- Latest comment date
- Author information
- Publication status and dates
- Search relevance ranking (when search is used)

**Statistics (Window Functions):**
- Total matching articles count
- Average content length across results
- Average comment count across results

**Sorting Options:**
- By date: created_at, publish_date, updated_at
- By engagement: comment_count
- By content: title (alphabetical), content_length
- When searching: search relevance rank

**Pagination:**
- Default: 20 articles per page
- Maximum: 100 articles per page

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Articles retrieved successfully (empty array if none match)
- HTTP 400: Invalid parameters
- HTTP 404: Author not found

**Use Cases:**
- Author portfolio/profile page
- Find popular articles by author
- Content management dashboard
- Search author's published work
- Analyze author's writing patterns
- Filter drafts vs published content

item.name: Comments
item.description: Operations for managing comments on articles. Comments can be created by anyone (with name/email) and associated with published or draft articles.

query.description: Article UUID (required, must be valid UUID of existing article)
Commenter name (required, 1-255 characters)
Commenter email (optional, valid email format, max 255 chars)
Comment text (required, 1-2000 characters)
Enable reply notifications (optional, boolean, default: false)
Allow commenting on unpublished articles (optional, boolean, default: false, usually admin only)

request.description:
Add a comment to a specific article.

**Required Fields:**
- `article_id`: UUID of the target article (must exist)
- `author_name`: Name of the commenter (1-255 characters)
- `content`: Comment text (1-2000 characters)

**Optional Fields:**
- `author_email`: Email address (valid email format, max 255 chars)
  - Used for notifications and gravatar
  - Not publicly displayed by default
- `notify_on_reply`: Enable email notifications (boolean, default: false)
- `allow_on_unpublished`: Allow commenting on drafts (boolean, default: false)
  - Typically only used by admins/editors
  - Normal users can only comment on published articles

**Validation:**
- Article must exist
- Article must be published (unless allow_on_unpublished=true)
- Author name: trimmed, 1-255 characters
- Content: trimmed, 1-2000 characters
- Email: validated format, trimmed, lowercased
- Input sanitization to prevent XSS

**Auto-Generated:**
- `id`: UUID (gen_random_uuid())
- `comment_date`: Current timestamp
- `created_at`: Current timestamp

**Response Includes:**
- Created comment details
- Article context (title, author)
- Notification settings

**Response:**
- HTTP 201: Comment created successfully
- HTTP 400: Validation error (invalid format, content too long)
- HTTP 403: Cannot comment on unpublished article
- HTTP 404: Article not found

**Use Cases:**
- Reader feedback on articles
- Discussion threads
- Community engagement
- Article reviews and responses

request.description:
Retrieve all comments for a specific article with advanced filtering.

**Required Fields:**
- `article_id`: UUID of the article

**Search & Filter Options:**

**Content Search:**
- `search_comment`: Full-text search in comment content
  - Uses PostgreSQL tsvector for intelligent matching
  - Case-insensitive with stemming support

**Commenter Filters:**
- `author_email`: Find all comments by specific email
- `has_email`: Filter by email presence
  - `true`: Only comments with email provided
  - `false`: Only anonymous comments (no email)

**Date Range Filters:**
- `created_after` / `created_before`: Filter by comment date

**Content Filters:**
- `min_length` / `max_length`: Filter by comment length
  - Useful for finding substantial vs brief comments

**Response Includes:**
- Comment details (id, content, author info, dates)
- Content length
- Article context (title, author)
- Email presence indicator

**Statistics (Window Functions):**
- Total comments count
- Average comment length
- Count of comments with email
- Percentage with email

**Sorting Options:**
- By date: comment_date, created_at
- By author: author_name (alphabetical)
- By content: content_length

**Pagination:**
- Default: 50 comments per page
- Maximum: 100 comments per page

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Comments retrieved successfully (empty array if none)
- HTTP 400: Invalid parameters
- HTTP 404: Article not found

**Use Cases:**
- Display article comments section
- Moderate comments by content
- Find comments by specific users
- Analyze comment engagement
- Filter spam/short comments
- Export comment data for analysis

item.name: Statistics
item.description: System-wide statistics and analytics for the blog platform.

query.description: Filter statistics by content search (optional, full-text search in articles)
Filter statistics by comment search (optional, full-text search in comments)
Time period filter (optional, options: day, week, month, quarter, year, all, default: all)
Filter statistics for specific author (optional, UUID format)

request.description:
Generate comprehensive statistics overview for the entire blog system.

**Optional Filters:**
- `search_content`: Filter by content search (affects article-related stats)
- `search_comment`: Filter by comment search (affects comment-related stats)
- `timeframe`: Time period (day, week, month, quarter, year, all)
- `author_id`: Limit statistics to specific author

**Statistics Categories:**

**1. Author Statistics:**
- Total authors registered
- Active authors (with at least one article)
- Newest and oldest author registration dates
- Most active author (by article count and engagement)

**2. Article Statistics:**
- Total articles count
- Published vs draft articles
- Average article length (characters)
- Latest and earliest publication dates
- Authors with articles count
- Publication rate (published/total ratio)

**3. Comment Statistics:**
- Total comments count
- Unique commenters (by email)
- Average comment length
- Latest and earliest comment dates
- Articles with comments count
- Comments with email provided
- Email percentage

**4. Engagement Metrics:**
- Average comments per article
- Most commented article (title, count)
- Most active author (username, articles, comments)
- Comment engagement rate

**Advanced Features:**
- Uses Common Table Expressions (CTEs) for complex aggregations
- Window functions for averages and rankings
- Full-text search integration
- Filtered statistics (apply search to see targeted metrics)

**Calculated Metrics:**
- Publication rate: published / total articles
- Draft ratio: drafts / total articles
- Email percentage: comments with email / total comments
- Comments per article: total comments / total articles
- Author engagement: comments per article per author

**Response:**
- HTTP 200: Statistics generated successfully
- HTTP 400: Invalid parameters (unknown timeframe, invalid UUID)

**Use Cases:**
- Admin dashboard
- System health monitoring
- Content strategy analysis
- User engagement metrics
- Platform growth tracking
- Performance reporting
- Demo showcases
